p: The posterior set of trees from each of the three initial BEAST analyses was used as an empirical tree set for a discrete-trait phylogeography analysis [ 35]. We assumed an asymmetrical rate matrix. For each tree sampled from the MCMC, Markov Jumps procedure [ 36] was used to reconstruct a stochastic realization of the between-country diffusion process; results were summarized over the entire posterior distribution by calculating median numbers of transitions between each pair of countries and the posterior probability that at least one transition occurred.
